required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Treatment of Keloids With Fractional Erbium Laser-Assisted 5-Fluorouracil Versus Laser-Assisted Corticosteroid
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective Triple-Blinded Single-Center Study of Laser-Assisted 5-Fluorouracil Versus Laser-Assisted Corticosteroid Treatment for Keloids

brief_summary.textblock: This is a split-scar study with a target sample size of 20. There are two interventions: fractional erbium:YAG-assisted drug delivery of 5-fluorouracil and fractional erbium:YAG-assisted drug delivery of triamcinolone acetonide. Patients will undergo treatments in a series of 4 treatments at approximately 4 week Â± 1 week intervals. Investigators will monitor for safety and continued benefit after the end of the interventional treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in POSAS score in Site A and Site B at first visit (pre-treatment) versus last visit (post-treatment)
primary_outcome.description: The observer scale of the POSAS consists of six items (vascularity, pigmentation, thickness, relief, pliability and surface area). All items are scored on a scale ranging from 1 ('like normal skin') to 10 ('worst scar imaginable'). The sum of the six items results in a total score of the POSAS observer scale.

primary_outcome.measure: Modified Hamilton score of Site A and Site B
primary_outcome.description: Obtained by comparing clinical photographs of the scarred skin and healthy skin next to each other in Site A and Site B. The Hamilton scale consists of 4 items with a score range of 0 to 14 where 14 represents more severe scarring.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in scar measurements of sites A and B of the keloid treated with laser-assisted 5-FU versus laser-assisted TAC
secondary_outcome.description: The measurements will be calculated as the total volume (length x width x height) in cm3 of the scar, or length x width in cm2 if the scars are flush with the surrounding skin scar surface

arm_group.description: One half of keloid scarring on a single subject
One half of keloid scarring on a single subject

intervention.description: Split-scar fractional ablative erbium laser-assisted delivery of 50mg/mL of 5-fluorouracil solution to one half of the scar (4 treatments)

intervention.intervention_name: Fractional erbium:YAG-assisted drug delivery of triamcinolone acetonide
intervention.description: Split-scar fractional ablative erbium laser-assisted delivery of 10 mg/mL of triamcinolone acetonide solution to the other half of the scar (4 treatments)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria
1. Age 18-89
2. Has one large keloid scar or at least two similar but separate keloid scars
3. Keloid present for at least 1 year
Exclusion Criteria
1. Currently pregnant
2. Currently breastfeeding
3. Have taken oral retinoids within 6 months of study initiation
4. Has had keloid treatment within 1 month of study initiation
5. Has active infection at treatment site
6. Has active malignancy
7. Presence of pedunculated keloid(s) or keloid(s) that are judged to be best treated with surgical excision first
8. Hypertrophic scars
9. Known hypersensitivity to TAC or 5-FU
10. Chronic systemic corticosteroid or immunosuppressive medication use
11. Has intolerance to anesthesia
12. Has known connective tissue disease
13. Has known infectious disease

patient_data.ipd_description: The de-identified participant data from the final research dataset used in the published manuscript will be shared upon reasonable request beginning 9 months and ending 36 months following article publication or as required by a condition of awards and agreements supporting the research provided the investigator who proposes to use the data executes a data use agreement with NYU Langone Health. Requests may be directed to the PI. The protocol and statistical analysis plan will be made available on Clinicaltrials.gov only as required by federal regulation or as a condition of awards and agreements supporting the research.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Beginning 9 months and ending 36 months following article publication or as required by a condition of awards and agreements supporting the research.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Requests should be directed to nayoung.lee@nyulangone.org. To gain access, data requestors will need to sign a data access agreement.
